intro: Pterostephanus runcinatus, commonly known as the slender pterostephanus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found growing in rocky soils and along riverbanks. The plant has a long, fibrous root system that helps it survive in dry conditions.
